result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Gregory Howlett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Gregory Howlett

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle DA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY: Nicholas Davis appears on behalf of  Dan Firkus   DF:  Michael Gregory Howlett appeared. Case called at 11:05 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a status conference. DA Nieskes is moving to amend to Co. Ord. 55 Obstructing. Atty Davis gives update on status of DE. DE pleads NO CONTEST to amended Ct. 1 Co. Ord. 55 Obstructing. Court accepts amendment and no contest plea, finds the DE guilty and orders $250.00 forfeiture. Bond on file to apply.
